result.execSummary:
The defendant Denard A Rowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Denard A Rowell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Denard A Rowell was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Denard A Rowell was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Denard A Rowell was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denard A Rowell

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Reservation of Rights and letter from defendant.

Defendant Denard A Rowell in court with attorney Peter John Arnold.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to:
Count 1:
-Serve 33 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 33 days time served.  
THIS IS A TIME SERVED DECISION

Count 3:
-Serve 40 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 40 days time served.  
THIS IS A TIME SERVED DECISION

Count 6:
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 90 days time served.  
THIS IS A TIME SERVED DECISION

Court costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge as 'to' all 3 counts, is to be paid by 10/6/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Denard A Rowell in court with attorney Peter John Arnold.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court vacates previously issued bench warrant (warrant is in the file). Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Peter John Arnold in court.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.

Defendant placed under oath. State complied with victim notification.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, AND 6
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 4, AND 5
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered counts 2, 4, and 5 DISMISSED.

Filed, 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form. 

Case adjourned to branch 15 for Sentencing.
Court orally amended, amended information, by stipulation of parties. Court omitted the wording: abusive, boisterous, indecent, profane, violent, and unreasonably loud.

Defendant Denard A Rowell in court with attorney Peter John Arnold.  Defendant Denard A Rowell in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. Amended Criminal Complaint, received and filed. Copy provided to defense, who waived reading. Court VACATED Jury Trial scheduled for 9/28/2015 at 8:30 am. 

AMENDED INFORMATION READS:
Count 1: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) and 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor. 
Count 2: Child Enticement (Giving Controlled Substances), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.07(6) and 939.50(3)(d), a Class D Felony.
Count 3: Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)  961.41(3g)(e), a Class U Misdemeanor.
Count 4: Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor) (Commit New Crime of Disorderly Conduct, Count 1), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 5: Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor) (Commit New Crime of Child Enticement, Count 2), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 6: Bail Jumping (Misdemeanor) (Commit New Crime of Possession of THC, Count 3), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from the defendant received and filed. sab

Defendant Denard A Rowell not in court, defendant in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Arnold was not present when case called but contacted the court after dates were set and stated that the dates were acceptable for his calendar.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 Safety Building.
Case set for final pretrial on 9-9-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 9-28-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 8-24-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Denard A Rowell not in court, defendant in custody.   Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  List from SPD was just received and Peter Arnold has been appointed but has not checked in yet.  Court will adjourn matter to 7-27-2015 at 8:15 for status of counsel.
Later, Atty Arnold calls the court and is given the next court date and states that he does not require the defendant to be present.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Received from defendant: Motion to Waive Counsel; Motion to Dismiss and letter to the court.
(Note:  documents are written in pencil and are too light to scan and read)

Defendant wishes to proceed pro se and represent himself at trial.  Defendant states that he is prepared for trial today.  CASE PASSED.  In chambers discussion is held.  Case recalled.  Atty Liggins states that based upon her last meeting with the defendant on Friday she believes that their communication has broken down and she no longer can effectively represent him.  Also, Atty Liggins feels threatened by the defendant due to inappropriate statements that have been made to her.  Asked by the court, counsel does not feel that she could act as 'stand-by' counsel. The court will allow counsel to withdraw and orders case referred back to SPD for appointment of counsel, possible stand-by counsel.  Atty Liggins will refer case to appointment desk.
Case is set for SPEEDY TRIAL (expiration date of 7-22-2015).  The court finds CAUSE to adjourn trial and advises the defendant that me may reassert his speedy trial if he wishes on the next court date.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Report of Dr. Collins has been reviewed by all parties and there are no challenges.  Based upon the agreement of parties, the court will adopt the opinion of the doctor to a reasonable degree of  professional certainty and will find the defendant competent to proceed.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Prepared by Dr. Jenna Hernke. Received and filed.
Filed by the state:  Motion in Limine, Witness List, Notice of Expert Testimony, Requested Jury Instructions, Substantive instructions

Defendant Denard A Rowell in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Denard A Rowell in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant had entered a speedy trial demand which expires on 7-22-2015.  Case set for jury trial on 7-13-2015.  The clerk contacted the Forensic Unit to find out if a return of report is possible by July 13; Dr. Pankiewicz can complete the report, however, he will not be available for testimony on July 13.  The court will keep case on for trial and will deem the speedy trial waived.
Copies of the report may be emailed to the state and defense; addresses to be provided on order.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defense motion to modify bail is argued and DENIED by the court. Bail to stand.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Denard A Rowell not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Speedy trial demand.  Case set for final pretrial on 7-1-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-13-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 5-18-2015.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/13/2015 received and filed. (12 pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Alexis Liggins 819 North 6th Street Milwaukee, WI 53203.

Defendant Denard A Rowell in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Denard A Rowell in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andre Antreassian-Oak Creek Police Department Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.B.M, S.M.M., L.G., J.T., T.H., and the Motel 6 located at 1201 W. College Ave.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Denard A Rowell in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Denard A Rowell in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters pleas of Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Counts 3, 4, 5, and 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
